Authors: Chang-Hsin Kuo, Teik-Khiang Goh, Chi-Yu Chen
Title:
Wenhsuimyces chiayiensis gen. et sp. nov., a hyphomycete on
submerged culm of Miscanthus floridulus from Taiwan
Keywords:
Dematiaceous hyphomycetes, dictyospores, Dothideomycetes,
freshwater fungi, systematics, Tubeufiaceae
Abstract:
Wenhsuimyces chiayiensis gen. and sp. nov. from submerged
wood in a freshwater stream of Alishan area, Chia Yi County, Taiwan, is
described and illustrated. It produces large ovoid muriform solitary
thallic conidia which are dark brown to black, but encased in a layer of
subhyaline peripheral cells. The conidia are produced singly at an
oblique angle to the conidiophores which are borne from superficial
hyphae on the natural substratum. The genus is compared with other
similar dictyosporous hyphomycetes. Conidia of this fungus germinated
readily in culture. Colony morphology is described and its phylogenetic
relationship is inferred by comparing the ITS region of the rDNA.
